website_summaries.verdict: Features a compression pad that helps relieve forearm fatigue in addition to providing support.
pros: Brace protects tendons from additional strain
Compression pad adds extra pressure to relieve pain and fatigue
Fastens with two adjustable hook-and-loop straps that stick to the brace
cons: The hook-and-loop straps may wear out relatively quickly

customer_reviews.title: Works
customer_reviews.text: Goodness only knows how I messed up my arm but I did. I got to where I couldn’t get the milk out of the fridge with my left hand because of the pain on my forearm outside of my elbow. Anyway, I ordered this and it sort of helped while I worked out, but what really worked was wearing it for a day at a time. After about a month, wearing it off and on for a day at a time, it’s all better. No pain, no need for the brace.
customer_reviews.author: Chilli

customer_reviews.title: super comfortable and supportive
customer_reviews.text: you know how sometimes braces and ace bandages almost burn against your skin after a long time of wear, and you feel itchy? there is no such problem with this brace. it's extremely supportive of my elbow and so comfortable to wear that i forget i'm wearing it. i can easily sleep in it and wear it all day with no irritation.
customer_reviews.author: prune tracy

customer_reviews.title: Skeptical Turned Believer
customer_reviews.text: I was very skeptical when I bought it that it would actually work. I have been dealing with tendonitis in my left arm for a while off and on due to weightlifting and other sports activities and it flared up again. This time I decided to try to use this to help it, within one use the flare up was greatly reduced to the point of almost being gone. I am going to continue using it to maintain the lack of pain. Love it!
customer_reviews.author: Bspitzack

customer_reviews.title: I read the reviews b4 I ordeeed this which receiver did great ones but I still was a bit skeptical
customer_reviews.text: OMG! I read the reviews b4 I ordeeed this which receiver did great ones but I still was a bit skeptical. Not anymore! Thus brave is amazing. I don’t sleep with it but I do wear it all the time and my tennis elbow feels 1000 times better. Even within a day it felt better. I have had this before and had a cortisone shot. It helped but the shot was so painful I would rather give birth to 50 children. This is a must try. You won’t be sorry
customer_reviews.author: karisma7

customer_reviews.title: great combination. my fatigue has been greatly reduced due ...
customer_reviews.text: I work on the computer all day and have been getting pain in my arm and this band has made a big difference. I use the "Roleo massager" to help work the muscles and wear this band....great combination. my fatigue has been greatly reduced due to this band.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Godsend
customer_reviews.text: I'm a mobile groomer who brings everything to the clients home and grooms the dog in their home.. That said, equipment is heavy and there's a lot of it.. I recently had the worst tennis elbow I've ever had, excruciating pain... Got this and BAM...no more tennis elbow..its like magic.. I would recommend this to anyone suffering from that kind of pain.
customer_reviews.author: Animal Lover

customer_reviews.title: Threw away all my other forearm braces.
customer_reviews.text: I have three braces right now, before this one. Judo for 8 years, Kickboxing for 14 before it. My wife uses them occasionally (tennis and swimming). They're always hard to adjust, or "one size fits all" that never fits quite right. This one - three straps, adjustable like crazy. The smaller strap along would work for my 5'0 wife, or my 11 year old daughter. The two others go from "regular guy" to "body builder". The straps switch out in about a minute the first time you use them, and less than 30 seconds after you have it down. I'm throwing away the other three.
customer_reviews.author: KB

customer_reviews.title: Effective
customer_reviews.text: I have an average to skinny adult male forearm and it's almost too large for me. That said it's very effective for my chronic epicondylitis. Update--when I first applied the device I had difficulty knowing what to do with the closures which ran in to one another. What I have figured out is that you can put one in place on the velcro then the other one will stick to the back of the first one.
customer_reviews.author: D. Nelsen

customer_reviews.title: POOR, PAINFUL PERFORMANCE
customer_reviews.text: I don't like the design of this brace. The loop the strap slides through doesn't keep it's shape, meaning when it is tightened the loop slips longways. When this happens it strangles the strap, allowing the Velcro to jag into your arm, and your skin to be pulled into the loop and pinching your skin. Not a good design!
customer_reviews.author: KS DEED

customer_reviews.title: It works
customer_reviews.text: It worked for me. I ended up with tennis elbow after recovering from an accident. This brace helped, it relieved my pain and allowed me to lift additional weight normally restricted by pain. I wore it at work, under my dress shirt, no one noticed. Even out in town with my short sleeves, blended well with my attire. The only criticism I can say about the brace is it did get a bit warm, even sweaty at times but that was only after prolong use. I didn't care because the pain relief was worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Zero

customer_reviews.title: Extremely comfortable brace that's helped me with my bench press!
customer_reviews.text: This brace is designed with very comfortable material. I could leave it on for hours and not realize it's there. The compression pad really helps keep pain away when I'm putting my elbow through strenuous work. I wear this while bench pressing and longer have wobbly elbows!! I was also able to add another ten pounds to the bar! These things are great to wear for those with problematic elbows who enjoy weight lifting.
customer_reviews.author: Superdesi

customer_reviews.title: Worked for about a week then skin reacted.  Material not breathable
customer_reviews.text: Helps relieve my tennis elbow. I see this as a temporary pain reliever and it works great. Pros: Material is comfortable Strap is adjustable Looks great Cons: None *Update* After about a week of using this brace my skins where it contact reacted/broke out in hives. I know I'm not allergic to the material and kept it clean. My guess is that the material is not breathable. How ever I did pick up a different brace and it's been working for me. *Update - Giving them a another star for customer service. Great customer service is always a big deal for me. They give me my full refund even after the return date due to lost communications.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Pros and Cons

customer_reviews.title: Did not help with my elbow pain
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this because I’ve had golfer’s elbow or medial epicondylitis for a bout a month and when I saw the good reviews on it, I thought I should try it out. But It not only didn’t take my pain away, it hurts my arm when it’s on and when I take it off my muscles are very sore.
customer_reviews.author: Sheila Majid

customer_reviews.title: Tendonitis is gone!
customer_reviews.text: Didn't think it was possible but the pain in my right elbow is gone! I've been wearing this brace everyday since I received it in the mail and it has worked wonders. Initially, it took about three days before I noticed a difference. Now, even after I mow the grass I don't have any pain. Wonderful product that was well researched before making it available to the public. I can't say enough nice things about it. A job well done!
customer_reviews.author: Hobart

customer_reviews.title: fair
customer_reviews.text: I would consider this item to be a fair product for relief for tennis elbow. While it is on, I feel the comfort in the muscle area in that part of the arm, but I feel once I get out on the court, it is not going to stay in place. The instructions say make it snug, but that you should be and the easily slip a finer under it. If I do this, I can't see how it will stay in place during racquetball. Additionally, as someone else has mentioned, the symbol looks too much like the Nazi organization, so I used a Sharpie to remedy that.
customer_reviews.author: gary assassin

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use, Not for small arms
customer_reviews.text: Contrary to several reviews I read, I did not find this complicated to put on yourself, or to identify where the pressure should be applied (if you have trouble with that, you might not have the symptoms this is meant to address). I am working up to wearing it for longer periods of time, but it is already helpful with pain relief after a couple days. The only issue I have is that the smallest band is almost too small for a healthy (not thin) female forearm, and I already see it relaxing a little bit so I will be trying to modify it as it gets too big.
customer_reviews.author: Catherine

customer_reviews.title: Don't pass on this if you need one
customer_reviews.text: I have had several different kinds of these and like this one the best by far. It is easy to put on and brings relief to my aging elbows/arms. Tennis elbow/golfers elbows and a bad shoulder up above bring me a lot of pain. I have enjoyed a little break from some of that using this. I also like the optional band sizes for different pressure. This was worth the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Honest Opinions

customer_reviews.title: Useless for tennis elbow
customer_reviews.text: I am very disappointed. This strap is useless for me. It does not provide anywhere near the amount of focused pressure I need. The pad is much to large and soft, and when tightened as much as possible, it just cuts off circulation in the arm, rather than pressing hard on the tendon that needs compression. This wrap seems 100% identical to many others here on Amazon, all surely made in the same factory. I want a refund.
customer_reviews.author: texorama

customer_reviews.title: This is elbow brace will work for medial epicondylitis as well. The 50% off promotional code with purchase is bogus.
customer_reviews.text: These are really nice elbow braces. The product photo shows it being used for lateral epicondylitis (tennis elbow) but I suffer from medial epicondylitis (golfer's elbow) and they work equally well by placing them on the inside of my elbow rather than the outside. Unfortunately, the package comes with a bogus offer to purchase other elbow braces from the company website for 50% off, which is absolutely false. The half-off promotional code does not work and I read many other complaints by other purchasers who disappointed to encounter the same problem.
customer_reviews.author: K.M.

customer_reviews.title: Velcro Wears Out Too Quickly
customer_reviews.text: My husband’s thoughts: For mild tendonitis this would probably be helpful. However, Velcro stopped working after a month and a half of use. Buckles would dig into his arm when it was tight. Now he can no longer tighten it to where it needs to be. It helped a bit at the beginning but did not completely eliminate his issue. He feels his issue was a bit too severe for complete relief. Now with the Velcro not working it doesn’t do much. He said he wishes he would’ve paired it with a wrist brace from the beginning. We’ll be looking for a similar product as it helped some when it was working.
customer_reviews.author: T. Bean

customer_reviews.title: Glad I Found this Product on Amazon!
customer_reviews.text: Glad I found this product on Amazon! It really does help with tendonitis. I've just had the brace a few days, but starting to feel relief from my pain. It does make my arm feel bruised when I take it off, but I do not have any bruising on my skin. I may be wearing it wrong. It is much easier to deal with than dealing with the pain of tendonitis I'm suffering from Golfer's Elbow even though I don't play golf. The tendonitis is work related, as I am a nail tech. I wish it came in a nude color, so it wouldn't be as noticeable. This brace is the best!
customer_reviews.author: Ms.Vickie

customer_reviews.title: but it is great. Keep my elbow supported and my tendonitis is ...
customer_reviews.text: wasn't sure how this was going to work, but it is great. Keep my elbow supported and my tendonitis is not aggravated while golfing or biking. It's pretty big - so that's the reason for the 4 stars. Wish there was a ladies version.
customer_reviews.author: Debie K.

customer_reviews.title: Make sure to wear it snug for optimal results.
customer_reviews.text: I’ve been using this brace for about 4-6 weeks and didn’t think it was helping. Then a physical therapist suggested i tighten it more than i was wearing it and it made a world of difference. So make sure you are pulling it fairly snug. Not uncomfortable but definitely works better wearing it tight. It takes 6 months to heal usually according to the patient i spoke with.
customer_reviews.author: Ellen Logsdon

customer_reviews.title: WOW
customer_reviews.text: I have been trying all kinds of things to help with the tendinitis in my arm. Tens, heat, ice, full arm compression, and bengay. Up till now nothing did a great job. Had some minor relief, but nothing lasted. Don’t know if this will last, but day one has brought tremendous relief. I have only had a few minor twinges that didn’t last very long. I will continue to wear this as it really really helps.
customer_reviews.author: Robert S. Prinzing

customer_reviews.title: Comfort and longevity ...
customer_reviews.text: This item is a great look and feel, (I did get one person asking if it had anything to do with the Nazis) But aside from that foo-pah This item is great. Its not overly rigid yet does the job. Many are so cushioned they look raised too much at the forearm, but this blends easily into my wardrobe. The colors pop and thats what I needed exactly. It cleans well, and seems to last so far, very well.
customer_reviews.author: Handy Dandy.

customer_reviews.title: It works!
customer_reviews.text: Definitely worth the purchase! I was hurting so bad having (golfers elbow) or cause I clean houses daily and swim etc. I couldn’t even push the pool noodle in the water my elbow hurt so bad. But I was totally amazed the first day I wore it I could feel so much less pain . It has been a big relief to my elbow and me I was at the point of miserable daily, not anymore. Thank u for all the other good reviews and I am much happier now. It’s only been a week I’ll def keep wearing it if thats what makes me more comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: megan

customer_reviews.title: Tennis elbow without playing tennis?
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this after having tennis elbow in my left elbow. Don't recall playing tennis but may have stick throwing elbow, cat wrangling elbow or 12 pack pick up elbow or fish catching elbow. Well, anyway it does help reduce the pain and I would recommend to anyone with this annoying problem. The package comes with three velcro straps for different arm widths. Very happy with the product. Now I just need to find that stick.
customer_reviews.author: Mary G.

customer_reviews.title: Golph Elbow
customer_reviews.text: Have only worn this brace for a couple of days. I put it on in the evening and leave it on until i get up . Not quite sure I am wearing it correctly. The pad part is pretty small and I'm not able to get it to sit over the exact location of my discomfort. I'm guessing that something with a larger compression area would have been a better choice. I'll continue to use it and if anything changes I'll revisit this...
customer_reviews.author: Jo-Ann Close

customer_reviews.title: It works!
customer_reviews.text: I don't write reviews unless a product is outstanding. After some research of many brands of this similar product I purchased this one for my worsening tennis elbow. Once you come up with a method of putting it on and then find the sweet spot where the gel pod must lie this thing works great. It is not a miracle cure, but a way to lessen the pain. I wear it all day and noticed the improvement almost immediately. It also helped improve my grip which was affected by this tendonitis. Great item.
customer_reviews.author: Boston Ed

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for tennis elbow
customer_reviews.text: I was diagnosed with tennis elbow 3 months ago (no I do not play tennis!) and was given an arm brace, which worked well until the velcro no longer "held" due to all the use. I purchased these on Amazon and I'm so happy! They work fantastic, are a great price and relieve the nerve pain, allowing me to use my arm without causing more damage, while the nerve heals. HIGHLY recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Salt Lake City, UT

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: I have worn this for roughly a month now with very bad tennis elbow. Once I found the perfect spot to wrap this in front of my elbow it has worked wonders. It doesn't fix the pain over night, but with continued use it makes a world of difference! Before the strap I could barely pick up my cup of coffee! The only problem I have, and it may be because I'm an auto mechanic, is the velcro strap keeps wanting to pop off when i bend my arm to get my hand into tight spots at work. I'm worried that after a while the velcro will be worn out. Other than that it's an awesome product
customer_reviews.author: alan

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable and durable
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the Tennis Elbow Brace for my husband, so this review is actually from him. I put the brace on when it came in the mail. I have worn it for a few days now and it is comfortable, doesnt look or feel bulky and it sure took my mind off my elbow soreness. I notice my elbow sorenesss when I dont have it on. I havent had it long enough to totally relieve my probkem, but I will report back when I have.
customer_reviews.author: Domestic Cattle Queen

customer_reviews.title: Forearm Support
customer_reviews.text: I had some forearm pain from serving at a restaurant and then trying to do yoga. I can't wear it while serving, but it lets me continue to do yoga without hurting and the yoga itself relieves a lot of tightness. I also lent it to my roommate to help with his carpel tunnel (his was hurting specifically when he clicked, and this pad is able to sit right on that muscle).
customer_reviews.author: Beverly Lesley

customer_reviews.title: Uncomfortable, Ineffective
customer_reviews.text: I had really hoped to like this tennis elbow strap, but I found it extremely uncomfortable. The area that provides pressure on your forearm tendons is too small, and concentrates the pressure too much on such a tender spot. I actually ended up with tingling in my fingers as a result, even though the brace was not too tight. I returned it and bought a Mueller brand one instead, which is way more comfortable and effective for pain relief. I recommend the Mueller instead of this one.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Better than what my Orthopedist gave me.
customer_reviews.text: The velcro was coming undone on the strap I got from my Orthopedic visit diagnosing me with tennis elbow. I don't even play tennis. Anyway, this strap is WAY BETTER than what I paid twice the amount of this product for at my Dr's office. The small raised part makes it So easy to put the pressure on the tendon and relieve the pain during normal activity. Great Product!! Thank you for making it.
customer_reviews.author: H. Watson

customer_reviews.title: So far I like it
customer_reviews.text: I bought this brace for tendonitis pain in my elbow/arm probably due to working on the computer every day. The pain was so bad I was having trouble lifting things with my arm. I felt immediate relief while wearing it and the pain comes back when I take it off. It's fairly comfortable, probably about as comfortable as a brace can be. Easy to put on by myself. Time will tell how much it helps me.
customer_reviews.author: Courtney B

customer_reviews.title: They really help!
customer_reviews.text: I’m a hairstylist and have developed tendonitis (tennis elbow) in both arms. When it flares up, I wear these braces which really helps with the pain. Often I just wear them preventatively if I have a busy day. I didn’t like the red emblem so took a permanent marker and colored it black, which looks less obtrusive. Sure wish these came in flesh color too.
customer_reviews.author: LauraJJ

customer_reviews.title: it helps to heal my tennis elbow
customer_reviews.text: I got tennis elbow. Doctor said that I need to rest to heal it. However it's still bothered after 2 months with no exercising. My friend recommended to use a pressure-type elbow brace. I google it and it's been proved to help to cure the issue. I bought this one because of its design, reviews and competitive price. I've used for 3 months+ and the tennis elbow issue is 90% cured.
customer_reviews.author: Y. FEI

customer_reviews.title: Possible Tennis Elbow
customer_reviews.text: I tried this and it really didn't do anything for me. It's SUPER bulky. I only used it while going to sleep. No way I would wear this to work. I had to use the smallest strap and probably could've used the next one down. But I still had elbow pain/Tendonitits. This may work for some people, but for me it did nothing. Also, I kept adjusting trying to hit that one spot where the brace would help alleviate some of the pain and never got it right on the spot. So no clue.
customer_reviews.author: Master P.

customer_reviews.title: Terribly product
customer_reviews.text: There is not one thing I liked about this product. The directions for use are lousy.
customer_reviews.author: Plain old consumer

customer_reviews.title: Good one
customer_reviews.text: For some reason, I got pain at my left elbow. Especially after walking the pain was increasing. I saw some videos from doctors to use this kind of band. I tried this one by wearing the whole day initially (while sleeping also). It reduced the pain. Now I am just using when walking. It is worth to try if you have elbow pain.
customer_reviews.author: Madhu

customer_reviews.title: Don't wash it.
customer_reviews.text: It worked great until I washed it. The velcro didn't work as well afterwards. Pain relief was good while I could use it. I have small arms and it barely got small enough for me. The pad is wide enough to put pressure on all of the muscles and tendons for tennis elbow pain relief.
customer_reviews.author: Tonya

customer_reviews.title: Tennis elbow relief
customer_reviews.text: Used this for tennis elbow. Did relieve some of the pain, but when worn for extended period would cut off circulation causing a different kind of discomfort! Very easy to put on and use, fits different sizes easily. Can be used while working out, physical labor that kind of thing. Can be worn either under over long sleeves. It’s smaller than a compression sleeve which is nice
customer_reviews.author: Ellen

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable counter pressure for tennis or golfer's elbow
customer_reviews.text: Nice product, comfortable to wear. My only suggestion is to rethink the strap lengths that are provided. It comes with 3 lengths that you can swap out: 19", 16", and 9". The 19" seems only for people with really huge forearms. The 9" seems like it would only fit a child. What is needed is an intermediate length halfway between those two - say 14"
customer_reviews.author: SCBuzz

customer_reviews.title: This Brace Really Helped
customer_reviews.text: I was skeptical that this brace would really help my tennis elbow, but I have been very pleasantly surprised. The produce is well made and of study construction, is easy to slip on and off and has really helped relieve my aching elbow. I use it when I am working at the key board and there is a noticeable reduction in stress on the elbow when I have it on. I would highly recommend trying this product to treat tennis elbow.
customer_reviews.author: Blues Guy in Philly

customer_reviews.title: It's an ok brace. I usually wear it when ...
customer_reviews.text: It's an ok brace. I usually wear it when I don't want to know I'm wearing a brace. I'll wear an ACE brand that applies more pressure at night or at the computer. Different velcro strap sizes are a plus. Now the reason I gave it 3 stars...THE LOGO. I'd really think a redesign is in order. Two kinda zig-saggy white S's in a red round border on black...and it's an arm band!? A little too close to the Schutzstaffel for my tastes...and I'm not the only person who mentioned it. I now put a piece of Gaffer's tape over the logo.
customer_reviews.author: D. SCORZA

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: I got my Sleeve Stars Elbow Support today and has been wearing them for a few hours now. It's super comfy to wear. I have big arms and the included straps were more than enough to fit around them. If you have smaller arms, the product comes with extra straps that you can use to replace the one that's attached to the product itself. The materials that were used to make the product are also comfortable and not at all itchy. I've noticed a little improvement on my wrists, maybe because it's only been a few hours of use. I'll keep it on for the next few days to see if the pain on my wrists goes away.
customer_reviews.author: yabaaz

customer_reviews.title: Would reccomend..
customer_reviews.text: Was happy with it overall. I have severe tendonitis, and I knew it would not be a cure, but add some relief, which it has. As far as comfort, no brace is comfortable, but tolerable as a trade off for relief; This is no different. in that aspect. The quality of the brace is top notch, no complaints. Good product for moderate tendonitis pain..
customer_reviews.author: Matthew L. Glass

customer_reviews.title: Top quality, helped with my tennis elbow.
customer_reviews.text: It really helped with my tennis elbow. Build quality is top-notch, it has a soft yet solid padding in the inside which applies pressure. It stays in place and is also sweat absorbing. I've used it on hot days without any issues. It also contains a length adjustment extension strap in case you need to adjust the size and I believe with the extension it should fit everyone.
customer_reviews.author: Letshop

customer_reviews.title: Works like a charm for me
customer_reviews.text: Works like a charm for me. Alleviates my "golfer's elbow" pain. (I don't play golf, but I'm in my late 50's). I don't want to be gobbling painkillers. Make no mistake. It is not a cure, nor a replacement for a qualified medical assessment and treatment. But, for the reasonable price and excellent quality, it is definitely something to try. Very well made and designed, for the relatively small cost. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Arasellen

customer_reviews.title: It helps comfort my strained elbow.
customer_reviews.text: I have used this brace for several days and can feel it work. It provides the necessary pressure on my ligaments so my tennis elbow pain is not aggravated. the padding is wide so it covers a big area and also comes with 2 extra straps so I will have this brace working for long long period of time. I will get another one to alternate as I use it everyday and gets sweaty after I play.
customer_reviews.author: AJBR

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable and will fit a small arm!
customer_reviews.text: Elbow brace arrived in a timely fashion and accurately described by seller. Appreciated the 3 sizes of bands. I was concerned would not fit my small forearm of 8.5 " as the range of sizes went to 9". No problem! Fits great and is comfortable. I have wore it daily since receiving 4 days ago and has already helped relieving some of the pain while exercising. Time will tell if tendinitis completely abates. I Recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: TamTam

customer_reviews.title: It works!!
customer_reviews.text: Just putting the right amount of pressure in the right spot takes away most of the pain of tennis elbow. I wore this for about a month and then no longer needed it. I highly recommend it. You might need to adjust the placement and tightness every so often to get it "just right", but when you do you'll know it.
customer_reviews.author: Just-a-guy-that-buys-stuff

customer_reviews.title: Velcro no longer holds.
customer_reviews.text: This brace seemed to work fine for about two weeks until the velcro strap got worn out. Can no longer wear it and there seems to be no way to contact customer service if they even have one.
customer_reviews.author: Dodosh

customer_reviews.title: Wearing it now. Gave it a four star only ...
customer_reviews.text: Wearing it now. Gave it a four star only because it came very close to not fitting. Strap needs to be another inch longer. Men with muscular arms will have a hard time with the fit. Maybe offer a one size might fit all and large arm size?
customer_reviews.author: Coalman

customer_reviews.title: Worked for me
customer_reviews.text: It did provide the pressure as needed for relief. It appears to speed recovery. It's a bit tough to get the pad positioned exactly while trying to tighten the band. In retrospect, I would prefer the air pump band, recommended by my Physical Therapist. Then I could tighten the band, adjust and pump on the exact right spot.
customer_reviews.author: Roger Kinney

customer_reviews.title: Tennis elbow help
customer_reviews.text: Helped me to get rid of my tennis elbow. The brace doesn’t stay in place if you are active and use your arm, you must keep moving it back to the area of the bursa that’s inflamed. If this were not an issue I would give it a 5 star rating.
customer_reviews.author: Handyandy

customer_reviews.title: Comfort & helps heal
customer_reviews.text: More comfortable than the brace I received from my doctor. This works perfectly. My tennis elbow seems to be finally going away after 6 months of pain. I had no idea how these little bands could possibly help but they really do.
customer_reviews.author: Sooozie

customer_reviews.title: Didn’t help me
customer_reviews.text: I get pain in my forearm when I rock climb or do certain bicep heavy motions. I was hoping this would help, but it didn’t at all. I also assumed there would be two straps but there was only one. That’s my fault for not reading but just letting you know in case you assumed the same.
customer_reviews.author: Apple Luvr

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable
customer_reviews.text: To start off I am unsure if I have tendinitis to begin with. I have been complaining about pain and a coworker mentioned this product to me so I thought I would try it out. The band is very comfortable and I like that it has a variety of size bands that come with it. However I am unsure if this product is actually helping or making me have any less pain. I guess I should go to a doctor to have it checked out.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda Burrier

customer_reviews.title: Works
customer_reviews.text: Arm would not heal on its own with 5 months of taking it easy and 2 months of this... my pain is completely gone. Worked as I hoped.
customer_reviews.author: Mailman16T

customer_reviews.title: It seemed to work for me
customer_reviews.text: I've only used it a couple of times. I played tennis and I played pain free. However, I also do pull-ups. They still hurt. Interestingly, chin-ups do not. It was easy to adjust and it appears well made. A better test of its durability will be when summer starts and I am sweating.
customer_reviews.author: SLE

customer_reviews.title: Look for other options or even a sleeve
customer_reviews.text: Look at other options - the band was to replace an old Trufit band from Walgreens. This band velcro attachments are cheap and do not hold. They rip right off. I am not a big muscle guy, even little pressure was not suitable for the fake velcro strips. The contat are is small and grip is not tight. I never got the full compression feel as the ring type band. Band is going back.
customer_reviews.author: Sriram

customer_reviews.title: It works
customer_reviews.text: I bought one locally, the only one I could find. It was a sleeve with 2 pads, one on top for "tennis" elbow, one on the bottom for "golfers" elbow. The sleeve part cut off circulation in my arm and my hand started to swell. The SS Sleeve Star puts pressure just where you need it and doesn't cut off circulation. Works great. I should have waited to buy online.
customer_reviews.author: Ron Slusser

customer_reviews.title: Great for both men and women
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my tennis and golfer's elbow and it is very nice quality and fits well. I use it during crossfit particularly when doing pullups or power cleans. My husband borrowed it while he was lifting and complaining of elbow pain. The minute he put it on, he had instant pain relief. I ordered my husband one too. We both are very happy. I am 5'1" muscular 135# and he is 5'10" 170 lbs and it fits us both as the velcro wraps around for my smaller arm.
customer_reviews.author: JMesa

customer_reviews.title: Helps with Post-Tennis Elbow
customer_reviews.text: I had PRP treatment for tennis elbow, which worked. The doctor advised me to wear something like this as part of my post-treatment....it is comfortable, durable, and really does the job! Other than one fast-paced hitter I encountered in a match, which led to a lot of pain.....I have not had pain since wearing this. I play 2-3 times per week.
customer_reviews.author: Katy

customer_reviews.title: Good for large arm; can adjust tightness easily
customer_reviews.text: I don’t like to do reviews a day after i get a product but one thing I Already like is that I can pull it tight and it holds nicely. I’ve used other brands and they’re hard to get very tight. I use for racquetball and weightlifting. Good for a large arm: 12 inches around elbow and forearm.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Elbow Brace
customer_reviews.text: My doctor recommended I try an elbow brace for some tenditis in my elbow. This one really helped, after a couple of days my pain was gone. I still use it occasionally for flair ups. The adjustments make it comfortable and I can tighten or loosen it depending on what I'm doing.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Don't be skeptical, it works!
customer_reviews.text: I developed elbow tendinitis from weight lifting and needed something other than rest to help my rehab. I was skeptical but this brace really works. I don't always wear my brace to bed, so when I forget to wear it and experience elbow pain while sleeping, I put this thing on and it immediately reduces the pain. It literally works instantly to reduce the pain and this is not an exaggeration. I try to wear it throughout the day and also at night.
customer_reviews.author: TC

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had this for only 3 months and the strap will no longer stick to the Velcro. I did get significant pain relief when it was functioning but it is rather worthless if the Velcro won’t hold.
customer_reviews.author: Sheila

customer_reviews.title: Really works for me
customer_reviews.text: I tried this because I self diagnosed myself with Tennis Elbow - had it previously on other elbow so I am almost positive. This wrap puts pressure on the muscle and allows me to do my daily duties without the extreme pain This will give me relief and I can avoid surgery for awhile
customer_reviews.author: SC GrandMother

customer_reviews.title: This works
customer_reviews.text: Seems to be helping. Comes with one piece that has the actual “brace” part and three different size straps that you can change out for different arm sizes. I like the lower profile of this brace in comparison to some other braces. Overall - worth it.
customer_reviews.author: STACEY O.

customer_reviews.title: Just Ok.  Material Fails Quick
customer_reviews.text: I had it for 2 months and the elastic became very loose. I can barely wear it anymore as the band has to be stretched past the velcro for a proper fit. Really didnt provide the support I was hoping for.
customer_reviews.author: Robert C. Zimmerman III

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for helping to relieve tennis elbow symptoms
customer_reviews.text: This little bugger is absolutely amazing. I would have never in a million years have thought wearing something like this would make a difference but with tennis elbow it truly does. I have a job that irritates my tennis elbow, when I wear this it is minimal. I wish I had discovered something like this a long time ago. It is comfortable to wear and has plenty of cushioning.
customer_reviews.author: DonKeys

customer_reviews.title: Not clear instructions
customer_reviews.text: following the instructions on "you should be able to easily slide a finger between the brace and your arm" is too loose. It would always slide down my arm after a short amount of activity. I did not get any pain relief with this so I quit wearing it after a couple days
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: Recovering from Tennis Elbow
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this tennis elbow brace with compression pad after reading other's reviews of the product. I have used the product twice while playing tennis and it has definitely decreased the amount of discomfort in my arm while playing tennis. I would recommend this product to others experiencing the discomfort/pain from tennis elbow. I had tried other braces but this is much better than the others.
customer_reviews.author: Coni

customer_reviews.title: Works as advertised
customer_reviews.text: I have been struggling with tendonitis for some time now. I can always tell a difference when I wear it - whether I am exercising or just working around the house. It makes a huge difference in how I feel in that moment and later on. I highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: SuzieB

customer_reviews.title: but why two velcro straps to use???
customer_reviews.text: tendonitis in both elbows and have been using an Ace product (that works well), needed another and tried these, which are fine but I question why there are two pieces of velcro to tighten? One would suffice and actually make it easier to use
customer_reviews.author: David Sheets

customer_reviews.title: Wish I had looked more closely before I bought it
customer_reviews.text: It works as expected, but the company's SS logo definitely makes this look like a modern Nazi armband. I really wish I had looked more closely at this. I certainly don't feel comfortable wearing it in public, and I'll be purchasing a different brand.
customer_reviews.author: Peel

customer_reviews.title: This is magic!
customer_reviews.text: I don’t know how else to say it but this thing works. Super comfortable and alleviates my chronic elbow pain. This is the first tennis elbow brace I’ve ever tried, so I’m not sure what else is out there, but this one definitely does the job.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Kennerson

customer_reviews.title: Immediate improvement
customer_reviews.text: I got some kind of tennis elbow about 4 months ago, don't know why. I've been getting chiro treatment since then but not much relief. I put on this strap when it arrived a few days ago, and voila! There was an immediate reduction in the pain level! I've been wearing it 24 hours a day since. Even when I take it off briefly (to ice), the pain level stays low. My chiro says to wear it all the time for the first week, then take it off a few hours a day, and loosen it at night. So far it's very encouraging. Quality is excellent, and company seems to care.
customer_reviews.author: Bodhgaya

customer_reviews.title: Great product but...
customer_reviews.text: Great product, it took about month and a half to get and that why the four stars. To be fair they offer me a refund a week ago if I did not get the product but I held on to the hope that I would get it. I needed to get this brand.
customer_reviews.author: EJ

customer_reviews.title: Works better than I thought it would
customer_reviews.text: It works better than I thought it would. I've had tennis elbow pain for the past month or so. A copper & magnet bracelet helped some, but my elbow still hurt when using my arm. This brace has really diminished the pain when using my arm.
customer_reviews.author: Computer Guy

customer_reviews.title: Most comfortable brace I have found
customer_reviews.text: I recieved my elbow brace quickly. I have tried other ones in the past that were not comfortable. This brace is comfortable enough to wear all the time, I am even able to sleep in it. This is the best brace I have found to date for helping with my tennis elbow and carpal tunnel pain!
customer_reviews.author: sarah dashley

customer_reviews.title: Mama's little pain reliever!
customer_reviews.text: Haven't had it long but seems to be helping. I have a pretty large arm, this product fits it & had lots more room. I can actually sleep in it which days a lot because I can't sleep in jewelry or anything very restricting.
customer_reviews.author: jgunter72

customer_reviews.title: Will never know if it works as there is no instructions .
customer_reviews.text: when i opened these and found no instructions only a web address to download an ebook. i tried it and when i filled in my info and hit download nothing happened. So i'm stuck with these useless straps if i can't return them. nt a good way to do business.
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: Great Quality
customer_reviews.text: Hard to believe that this product could be improved. Once I made the purchase I received an e-mail regarding dealing with tennis elbow which mine has been DEBILITATING. I couldn't even squeeze a soda can and bend my elbow enough to bring it to my mouth without intense soreness. Since using this device the pain has reduced significantly now I can at least get through my days waiting for everything to slowly heal up. Never will I lift without using these on both arms again!
customer_reviews.author: Steve M

customer_reviews.title: Size is good and adjusts easily
customer_reviews.text: Size is good and adjusts easily. The material used to press down and relieve the tendonitis pain needs to be more dense. The soft spongy material just doesn't work fore me. I was able to work a ping pong ball under and that has helped me. Yes, it does look funny!
customer_reviews.author: KGM

customer_reviews.title: Works well reducing pain and strain.
customer_reviews.text: Simple product well made and effective. Much less obtrusive than other elbow braces I have used. All-over hook and loop material makes it easy to fit any size and it doesn't stretch or let loose with arm activity..
customer_reviews.author: Jim Ketcham

customer_reviews.title: Too flimsy
customer_reviews.text: I have tried a number of different bands for tennis elbow and with all the reviews here I figured I’d try this band. I was very disappointed. First of all the fit is way to flimsy for anyone with strong or muscular arms. Second, you can’t get it tight enough. 3rd. It is so soft it is not able to give any protection. Being so soft it might work for mild tennis elbow but for good protection I have found many better bands
customer_reviews.author: Bruce Lanham

customer_reviews.title: Love this brace
customer_reviews.text: Love this brace! I had lost my previous one I ordered and tried to replace it with one from a local drug store, it was not nearly the quality or effectiveness as this one. Great product for the price and works well!!
customer_reviews.author: Denise Star

customer_reviews.title: Right size with adjustable fit
customer_reviews.text: I like how easy it is for the user to put on and adjust. It covers the right amount of area and is as comfortable as a brace can be. It can only do so much to relieve pain but it certainly helps when performing daily tasks.
customer_reviews.author: Dennis R Hickethier

customer_reviews.title: Did not work great
customer_reviews.text: I would get pain in my elbow when working out, tried this product for a number of weeks, and it just did not help very much. Mostly it would shift around too much making it not worth the hassle.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan N.

customer_reviews.title: Thank you!
customer_reviews.text: My partner was in excruciating pain from tennis elbow for a long time. I convinced him to try this based on the positive reviews and the results have been amazing. More than any painkiller could do. It helps him so much.
customer_reviews.author: millefleurs

customer_reviews.title: Bulky and Smells
customer_reviews.text: Brace was very bulky and had a strong chemical smell. The "pad" was very hard and uncomfortable. They cheap one I bought in the drug store works much better and is more comfortable. It's better than nothing but there are much better braces out there. I cannot recommend this one.
customer_reviews.author: barn kittie

customer_reviews.title: Uncomfortable
customer_reviews.text: Does not help with pain, instead makes elbow more sore
customer_reviews.author: Heather Marie W.

customer_reviews.title: Nice design
customer_reviews.text: I haven't used this product for a sufficiently long time to be able to judge whether or not it's effective. Nevertheless, I can say that the materials, design and functioning are all excellent.
customer_reviews.author: richard elrauch

customer_reviews.title: Works at first, then becomes junk
customer_reviews.text: Great at first. Then the velcro goes and it gets stretched out. They give you various bands of ridiculous lengths, none of which are good for wrapping something around your forearm. I'd look elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen

customer_reviews.title: Poor Quality Velcro Fastener
customer_reviews.text: Velcro stickiness doesn’t last long. Now useless as an elbow brace.
customer_reviews.author: JB 2020

customer_reviews.title: The best thing
customer_reviews.text: Okay I want my G I was kind of on the bench on this one. This is Ashley very incredible cannot even describe to you how well this works. Put it on within a matter of minutes my tennis elbow Head stop throbbing so excited.
customer_reviews.author: Tracy Simon

product_meta.title: Tennis Elbow Brace with Compression Pad for Men & Women - Elbow Brace for Tendonitis, Tennis & Golfer's Elbow Pain Relief, Fits 9"-23", 3 Straps Included - (Single)
feature_bullets: ✅ ELIMINATE PAIN & DISCOMFORT: This tennis elbow brace is especially designed to relieve you from elbow pain that troubles you and your body. The compression pad is designed to give pressure to help your forearm recover from injuries and fatigue, while at the same time it protects your vulnerable tendons from further strain. This elbow brace for tendonitis is definitely a great choice for anyone suffering from tennis or golfers elbow tendonitis, and arthritis.

✅ THOUGHTFUL DESIGN: This handy bracelet features two fully adjustable hook and loop straps that stick anywhere on the brace, so that it can stay securely in your hand all day long. Note also that for your convenience you can also wear this amazing brace on both your right and left forearm! And as this tennis elbow splint can fit any forearm from 9-23 inches (22-59cm), it can be definitely used by both men & women.

✅ UNPARALLELED QUALITY & DURABILITY: Made of the highest quality materials (35% Nylon and 65% Neoprene) this pain-relieving brace is a product made to last. Rest assured that this bracelet will not wear out, no matter how long you use it! Its unmatched quality and great performance will never let you down!

✅ A VERSATILE BRACE FOR ANYONE IN NEED: This tennis elbow strap can be definitely used by any sportsperson who suffers from tendonitis or who wants to keep their arms shielded against injuries. Great for tennis, golf, volleyball, basketball and more. Note also that this brace can offer great relief to people with elbow pain caused by extensive computer mouse usage, work or any other cause!

✅ SUPREME COMFORT: This handy bracelet is made of flexible and breathable materials to ensure that you can still enjoy your favorite sports while wearing it. Its great fit and texture doesn’t restrict hand movement; in contrary it supports your swelled tendons, helping you go a step further!
